medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until 8 months prior to evaluation, when exertional dyspnea, shortness of breath, and fatigue developed. She was evaluated at the emergency department, where a chest radiograph showed a paraspinal mass in the right lower thorax. Two months later, a repeat chest radiograph showed the mass unchanged, and a CT scan revealed the characteristics of the mass. Since then, she reported occasional mild dyspnea on exertion, but no significant changes in her overall condition.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of asthma and arthritis in the left knee. Prior lung biopsy with unclear reasons showed no abnormalities.
medical_history.family_history: Two sisters had died of heart disease; there was no family history of hematologic cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Born in Cambodia, lives in the northeastern United States with her daughter, worked in a health-related field, stopped smoking cigarettes 15 years ago, drinks alcohol in moderation, and does not use illicit drugs.
